text: Chile is such a history of earthquakes
the buildings there are designed to
withstand earthquakes that's why there's
been no big aftershocks has been no
buildings collapsing and no reports of
deaths in the capital itself but as with
earth these kind of earthquakes
especially those deep under the sea it's
the following three or four hours that
are critical and this was a massive
earthquake about 8.3 on the Richter
scale and such as the size of the
earthquake is the tsunami warning is now
not just been issued for chili itself
and its 4,000 kilometer coastline but
Ecuador Peru Southern California Hawaii
and as far west as New Zealand right
across the other side of the Pacific so
the next couple of hours are going to be
pretty critical and crucial if those big
waves do start coming ashore in South
America and people on the other side of
the Pacific will start to get worried as
well actually has a long history of
earthquake sir thousands of people have
been killed ever since they started
keeping records as recently as 2010 500
people were killed when a tsunami hit
southern Chile after an earthquake so
jillians very aware of the dangers but
so far so good only reports of one or
two deaths and a few buildings in
smaller towns having been flattened but
it's that tsunami and the possibility of
big waves hitting the coast that most
people are worried about
